conclusion: To determine the motion direction from 2 to 3 seconds, analyze the velocity-time graph.
The velocity-time graph shows the particle's velocity as a function of time.
The positive direction is defined by the direction of the velocity vector.
From the graph, the particle's velocity is positive from 0 to 1 second.
From the graph, the particle's velocity is negative from 1 to 2 seconds.
The motion direction from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
The particle's velocity is positive from 0 to 1 second.
The particle's velocity is negative from 1 to 2 seconds.
The particle's velocity is positive again from 2 to 3 seconds.
The motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
The motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
